content: The passage discusses how to recruit participants for interviews in user research. It emphasizes the importance of determining interview goals before recruiting and creating a representative sample of the target population. The article provides some ways to search for potential interview participants, such as personal networks, social media platforms, and online interest-based groups. It also mentions third-party research recruiting agencies and paid services as options to find interviewees. The passage concludes by suggesting to reach out to participants through email and providing some tips on what to include in the message.
